com.mumfrey.liteloader.permissions

Interface Permissions

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ReplicatedPermissions
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LocalPermissions, ServerPermissions

    public interface Permissions
    Represents a set of permissions assigned by an authority
    Author:
    Adam Mummery-Smith

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean getHasPermission(java.lang.String permission)
      Returns true if the authority says we have this permission or false if the permission is denied or not set.
      boolean getHasPermission(java.lang.String permission, boolean defaultValue)
      Returns true if the authority says we have this permission or if the permission is not specified by the authority returns the default value.
      boolean getPermissionSet(java.lang.String permission)
      Returns true if the specified permission is set in this permission container.

    • Method Detail

      • getPermissionSet

        boolean getPermissionSet(java.lang.String permission)
        Returns true if the specified permission is set in this permission container.
        Parameters:
        permission - Name of the permission to test for
        Returns:
        True if the permission exists in this set

      • getHasPermission

        boolean getHasPermission(java.lang.String permission)
        Returns true if the authority says we have this permission or false if the permission is denied or not set.
        Parameters:
        permission - Name of the permission to test for

      • getHasPermission

        boolean getHasPermission(java.lang.String permission,
                         boolean defaultValue)
        Returns true if the authority says we have this permission or if the permission is not specified by the authority returns the default value.
        Parameters:
        permission - Name of the permission to test for
        defaultValue - Value to return if the permission is NOT specified by the authority
        Returns:
        State of the authority permission or default value if not specified
